item.title: Delegate In Java And C#
item.description: UnderStanding of Lambda in Java and C# â€ƒIn Java and C#, if you want to use lambda expression, then the object must first be a unnamed delegate. So in essence, lambda is a anonymous delegate. As we all know that delegate is a function pointer, although there is no delegate in Java, but we can use it like this: C# class Program { public delegate void delType(string s); static void Main(string[] args) { //Console.
